snippet: Radovan Karadzic will once again be facing two genocide charges for much of the brutal campaign across Bosnia during the 1992-1995 war.
abstract: Appeals judges at United Nations war crimes tribunal in The Hague reinstate genocide charge against Radovan Karadzic, wartime leader of Bosnian Serbs, reversing 2012 decision by lower court; ruling means Karadzic will once again face two genocide charges for much of the brutal campaign across large parts of Bosnia during the 1992-1995 war.
lead_paragraph: Radovan Karadzic will once again be facing two genocide charges for much of the brutal campaign across Bosnia during the 1992-1995 war.

headline.main: Genocide Charge Reinstated Against Wartime Leader of the Bosnian Serbs
headline.print_headline: Genocide Charge Reinstated Against Wartime Leader of the Bosnian Serbs
